website_summaries.verdict: The best rescue throw bag that balances cord length and visibility for use in rough waters.
pros: Large throw bag is self-draining to remain afloat even in rough water
Outer bag surface and floating rope are reflective for better visibility in the water
cons: The included cord is thin, making it difficult to grip securely while on a boat or ship

customer_reviews.title: On the water? Get one.
customer_reviews.text: I’m rating this five stars not because it’s anything amazing, but because it’s exactly what it claims to be at a reasonable price. This is one of those pieces of gear that could be easy to leave behind or simply not purchase to begin with because it’s likely you’ve never needed one. Having been through a life-changing kayak incident, I now have two strobes and two whistles attached to a top quality PFD and never paddle, even solo, without a throw bag and fresh water attached to my PFD. Buy it, Practice with it occasionally, and hope you never you get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and is very visible. Its true color is much better in person than in the picture, it's actually safety orange. I've worked water rescue on the Great Lakes for years and this throw bag is just as good as the high dollar ones.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: This throw rope is a perfect size for us
customer_reviews.text: I only kayak in slow rivers or quiet lakes but want my kids and I to learn how to help each other should something happen. This throw rope is a perfect size for us, it's not too long as our throwing distance isn't going to be huge, but the rope is strong enough to pull an adult back to land, and bright enough to be seen even in choppy conditions/poor lighting.
customer_reviews.author: sweetshything

customer_reviews.title: It's a floating rope in a bag
customer_reviews.text: Good product, as advertised. In SC its mandatory to have on the vessel so I bought it. It's a floating rope in a bag, I wish I had more to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boice

customer_reviews.title: Good Safety Product for Boating
customer_reviews.text: I fish the ocean and wanted a throwable in case someone fall over while fishing. I think it's a bit price for a bag and rope, but you can't put a price on safety. Haven't had to use it yet, but I leave it out on the fishing deck for easy access incase someone falls overboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the cost
customer_reviews.text: For a basic throw-bag with rope, this fits the bid perfectly. The only thing I'd suggest to anyone purchasing this with limited water rescue training: add something inside the bag that adds weight. It's a little light compared to what it should be. However, al things considered - it's exactly as it should be and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Addition to the Kayak Safety Must Have List
customer_reviews.text: This is a smaller version of the throw ropes we have on our work boats. They are light, handy, and compact for storage under an elevated kayak seat, and of sufficient length for most situations we encounter. I don't like to kayak without one on my kayak or at least one in a group.
customer_reviews.author: thedalles

customer_reviews.title: A good product for less cost
customer_reviews.text: I havent had to use these yet for any real situations but practiced on the river and seemed ok. These are alot more affordable than some of the big name brands for rafting so the value supports the good quality.
customer_reviews.author: RAH

customer_reviews.title: but really need something better.
customer_reviews.text: cord is quite thin and can be difficult to grip. I will keep this one as a backup, but really need something better.
customer_reviews.author: mythoughtsonit

customer_reviews.title: This is good because if you ever need to use it
customer_reviews.text: The picture does not do it justice. The bag is a much brighter orange and very visible. This is good because if you ever need to use it, you want the person and those around you (other boaters) to be able to see it. You just pull the knotted bit out of the top, give it some slack and put it under your foot, then throw the bag. I think I saw that it was supposed to have a whistle on the other end but I didn't receive one, don't care anyway as I don't know how that was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and visible
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and handy when kayaking. I strongly recommend watching some YouTube videos on the subject and then practice in your yard to get comfortable with the process. Don’t wait until you need to use it for real.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open
customer_reviews.text: good except for the lack of a grommet where the drawstring goes into the bag. the bag material tends to hang on the drawstring . this makes it hard to open the bag in a hurry which is kind of the point. Found a better one for less at Walmart
customer_reviews.author: cdjflyslow

customer_reviews.title: Great rope for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent throw bag for a 'quick & close' rescue. I tested it thoroughly. It actually throws better than my '75 custom rope. I got it as a backup to keep inside my play boat for safety and portage utility needs. Really a nice little throw rope at an extremely reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: MEddy

customer_reviews.title: Hope not to have to use
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for money. Hoping to not have to use. Comes with a black buckle strap to attach to post near lake.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling parent

customer_reviews.title: This should be on every boat.
customer_reviews.text: I have thankfully never had to use mine but it seams to be just as promised, andit is very nice. Easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't needed to use this yet, but an excellent piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this throw bag for my whitewater kayaking trips. It's an essential piece of safety gear and nobody should go without one. I haven't needed to use this in an actual rescue situation (and hope I never will), but the bag is well made, sturdy, and reflective/orange so you don't lose it. Overall I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: I'm use to a bigger size and assumed this was the same. Very little and I doubt if I will ever use it. Being small I doubt if it has enough weight to even throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Taqtase

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use this yet but I have tested on land. Works perfectly just as expected. Scotty continues to produce quality gear!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Noe

customer_reviews.title: Whitewater ready.
customer_reviews.text: Whitewater big brand quality! Not as big/long as full sized raft style but bigger than some kayak style Id call it Med Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: S Haley

customer_reviews.title: Must have for white water sports!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had to use this bag in an emergency, but i practice with it often and i feel alot more confident in taking people out in the canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good entry level throw bag at a great price. Rope is good quality and doesn't kink up too much. Outer case, while not the heaviest of material, seems durable enough. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Labar

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality and it's small and light enough I'll always ...
customer_reviews.text: Rope in a bag. 50' may be little short for rescue, I'm used to 75 but I got this as an emergency bag to keep on my SUP just in case. Seems good quality and it's small and light enough I'll always have it on me which is all I really wanted.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeDrinker

customer_reviews.title: Throw rope
customer_reviews.text: I like the throw rope and it is perfect for my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Judith C. Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Good product... but
customer_reviews.text: Keep bag on railing. Bag started fading color in. 1 week!!!
customer_reviews.author: jfrano

customer_reviews.title: Great throw bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great throw bag for emergency use! Haven’t needed to use it yet, but I have faith that this will be effective if ever I need it!
customer_reviews.author: Titanicfanatic

customer_reviews.title: great seller
customer_reviews.text: This item is a must have for ice fishing and snowmobiling, I will not head to the lake without this safety item
customer_reviews.author: paul murtha

customer_reviews.title: Nice thing to have on a boat
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never have to use it. We practiced throwing it in the parking lot. Repacked it many times. Nice thing to have on a boat, too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, I have used this for Whitewater Rescue Multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Works Great, I have used this for Whitewater Rescue Multiple Times. Has possibly saved drowning more than once. Used in Whitewater Rafting, the rope is strong enough to stop a boat in heavy floats.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: heavier rope - this is pretty thin and not sure it will work if I ...
customer_reviews.text: works, but next time I will buy, heavier rope - this is pretty thin and not sure it will work if I really need it ( not strong enough )
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Topliffe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This bag just helped save two people from a possible fatal low water funnel /trap situation on the Rio Grande, one experiencing a medical situation as well. Had we not had this bag we would have been pretty screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It's a rope, in a bag....
customer_reviews.text: It's a rope, we use it to tie kayaks together.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately we haven’t use it in a real emergency but is a great help for people to get about of the water
customer_reviews.author: Cheko

customer_reviews.title: Everything in one small package
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size easy to put anywhere lightweight Definitely a must have for anyone in water recreation
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cavallaro

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Throw bag works great for kayaking on the local rivers. The bag is easy to use for both the person throwing and receiving it in the river.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Throws great
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for our regular Kayak and Canoeing trips. I hope I never have to use it for an emergency. When testing it on the river it threw really well and was able to pull a floater to the side of the river and back up to us (we tend to use it high a current river when goofing around). Works great, throws great, and is at a price that is hard to beat
customer_reviews.author: Stuck

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: meets the coast guard requirements. Bought these when on the way to Canada for some kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Daughter says it should work awesome if she ever needs to use it
customer_reviews.text: Daughter says it should work awesome if she ever needs to use it. Hopefully the need will never arise. She loves how the bag is "weighted" and says it will help to get it to someone if needed, and she loves the reflective strip. Would recommend to anyone looking to add to their rescue gear or safety kit.
customer_reviews.author: bubbytaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of kit -- compact and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small boat. Can be easily thrown, includes small foam pad to ensure the bag floats. The line itself (rope) is very small in diameter, but is more than adequate to retrieve a victim or use to deliver a larger diameter line for towing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: Yup
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything you need in a throw bag, they could have included a caribiner to attach it to my boat. When it's go time and you have to use it, you have to remember to tie it on. No big deal if you keep a calm head
customer_reviews.author: Rikabod

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and the quality, a must have for a kayak.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the quality, a must have for a kayak.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Safety first! We have two ponds and lots of kids so I like to be prepared for anything.
customer_reviews.author: sharon w.

customer_reviews.title: Good safety line for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work well (though I hope I never really have to know). The bright color and reflective strip are a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: JIm D

customer_reviews.title: Great to have...just in case
customer_reviews.text: I keep this with my kayak gear just for added peace of mind. It's easy to repack and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Owski

customer_reviews.title: This has a really good heft, is easy to throw far
customer_reviews.text: This has a really good heft, is easy to throw far, floats, and feels very durable. Maybe it could be longer or a little more rugged, but it's a great deal of hi just want a rescue line to start out with.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kelderman

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: Played with it in the yard. Haven't actually thrown it in the water. Deploys nice and stuffs back in easily. Better safe than sorry and glad to have it on my kayak for those just in case moments.
customer_reviews.author: FireRobTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Great safety product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep in my kayak and another for my duck hunting boat. Good built quality and seems like it would be easy to throw. It’s about the size of a softball.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A Cook

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, looks durable. Time will tell how it stands up to UV.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hoffman Sr

customer_reviews.title: Good to have in your kayak in case of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good to have in your kayak in case of a bad swim or boat pinning. Will most likely never use it, so this option was more attractive than much higher priced brand name items. Doubles as a nice clothesline on multi day river trips.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gulden

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for river or shore rescue.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased primarily for ice fishing but I will also keep it in my boat during summer. I like that it's smaller than others. Yes throwing distance is compromised but for my needs it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love this floating rope bag
customer_reviews.text: Good quality - nice to have on my kayak - I can keep all my grandkids and their kayaks together when we break for lunch on the water. I'm very happy with this purchase and it was just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sayitforward

customer_reviews.title: it’s a great product. This will be perfect for water rescue ...
customer_reviews.text: I think for the amount you paid, it’s a great product. This will be perfect for water rescue training, but I think I would go with a higher quality product to trust in a true emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A

customer_reviews.title: Glad I didn't buy one for 3x the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believe the quality for the price. Two screwgate caribiners clipped on the loop on the bag and it easily extends all 50ft of rope with very little effort
customer_reviews.author: Flaco

customer_reviews.title: Saved on this
customer_reviews.text: Havent used it much but for the low price I see no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Wale

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. Bought to have as a quick access safety line for on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E.

customer_reviews.title: Good size to fit on a Kayak
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Good size to fit on a Kayak. It can be thrown accurately from a seated position. Bag empties without binding rope. Easy to throw the 50 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good weight.
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for daughter taking up kayaking. Throws well. Good weight.
customer_reviews.author: Wm F. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Dont leave home without one. Bank fishing or boating. It's a life saver
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these after watching a buddy save somebody's life with one. YES it works and YES it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I cannot complain. Already folded and ready to deploy, compliant with all regulations, and is nice and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good throw bag for the price! Looks exactly as shown in the picture. It is very compact and easy to throw.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for use with my kayak
customer_reviews.text: For the price this item can't be beat. It is perfect for use with my kayak. Light compact and yet extremely functional. I would probably invest in one with a little heavier and longer line for larger boats, but for kayaking it is great.
customer_reviews.author: John Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good quality. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Scarborough

customer_reviews.title: Works and Floats!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. A bit short, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barth

customer_reviews.title: It’s a throw bag/rope.
customer_reviews.text: It’s what I thought it would be? I don’t know what to write... sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, AND can't afford not to have one...
customer_reviews.text: Great, get-it but don't forget-it addition to your watercraft. Some places require these by law, some don't, but I'd get one anyway. It's cheap, light, and could be a lifesaver...
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: but I love having it there just in case
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use this yet, but I love having it there just in case. I have unrolled it before just to check it out and it seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: JMZ

customer_reviews.title: Solid deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great, product materials seem solid. I've yet to use it but during practice throws and re-bagging I've had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, very compact, and a good buy. I'm glad to have this when I go out on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Retsyo

customer_reviews.title: Great safety gear.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great throw bag for ice fishing or general kayaking/boating. Inexpensive and valuable safety equipment for every trip on the ice or water. A perfect way to keep 50 ft of safety line handy and easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: I returned this bag because the rope diameter was too ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this bag because the rope diameter was too small for my use. On the river I am more confident with a larger diameter rope.
customer_reviews.author: Onodacops

customer_reviews.title: Nice throw bag
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to have the safety of a throw bag and this is very nice, especially for the price. I take it out with me when I go kayaking. I also take it with me when I go ice fishing, just in case someone goes through the ice.
customer_reviews.author: CHILLINTHEMOST

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag and construction. Three times less the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality bag and construction. Three times less the price in your local boat & marina stores. I will probably get another one, but this time I'll do 75'.
customer_reviews.author: billy t edwards jr

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on the item and have enjoyed using it
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Great deal on the item and have enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. A very good safety tool to have on ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. A very good safety tool to have on board your boat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t use this in heavy rapids.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat it for the money. Only using it in mild rapids and flat water kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Alden

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Good little throw bag. Does what its intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Boyll

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. Bought one for each of my kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Bonipie

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: great for the price, hopefully I will never have the need for it but its there in case I do
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Just got it!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for whitewater excursions, and hope to never us it. Small, light weight, and will fit perfectly under my spray skirt I would recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: Good weight on the end so that it can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for ice fishing. Good weight on the end so that it can be thrown in case of emergency. Good quality product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wolla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight yet strong. Got one for everyone in the family for their kayak
customer_reviews.author: Philip Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like having the insurance of a throw rope while I’ve fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Taft Fam

customer_reviews.title: Scotty Throw bag
customer_reviews.text: Very good product - works very well in practice. I hope I never have to use it for real, but If I have to I know that I can depend on it to do the job it is intended for.
customer_reviews.author: D E Milch

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is ok for a throw rope for a person. Break strength is low.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little safer than just a throw fusion. Hope that I never need it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Clarke-gerrity

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must if you are boating or are around rivers/streams.
customer_reviews.author: M. Knuppel

customer_reviews.title: Great 50' throw bag for $20
customer_reviews.text: Great 50' throw bag for $20. Good size for narrow waterways. Throws well. Has internal flotation. I added a piece of 3/8” pvc tube to the receiving end.
customer_reviews.author: Ziv

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money worked as needed this past weekend on the river
customer_reviews.author: Stan Palla

customer_reviews.title: Don't know
customer_reviews.text: cant say much about this, I bought it for my son. He liked it.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: So far this product has done really well. The price was great and with the few times I've thrown it the rope has not gotten tangled or anything it is very easy to use. I also love the reflective strip and the bright orange color!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Well made and effective. i had the opportunity to ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and effective. i had the opportunity to use it several times in the few weeks that I have had it.
customer_reviews.author: IrishCat317

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Is now an integral part of my kayaking safety kit.
customer_reviews.author: Catharine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be high quality materials, have not used it, nor do I intend to!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Useful for close proximity rescues only
customer_reviews.text: Useful if the overboard client is close to the boat. Will not throw the full length of the rope. Count on about 30-35 feet max. If I had to do it over again, I would buy a 75' model.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Guy

customer_reviews.title: Ok but small
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but really small. not much bigger than a cantaloupe. Could be bigger for the victim in the water to be able to grasp better. There is plenty of room in the bag for more than the mere 50 feet of rope that comes in it. Think twice if 50 feet is enough for you, it's pretty short when you throw it out there!
customer_reviews.author: Simi Survivor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, should do it's job. bought for piece of mind on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Best throw bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: This throw bag works every bit as good as an expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Bighouse

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, bright orange/reflective and floats well. Rope seems very durable and easy to throw/reload in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cody kaylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ended up buying this after buying one for our boat. Now one in each boat.
customer_reviews.author: cspar

customer_reviews.title: Great rope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Did a few practice throws and decided to carry on the kayak. Wouldn't hesitate to throw it to someone in need.
customer_reviews.author: Denny D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heat tool I hope I never have to use. Inspires confidence (just in case)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Purcell

product_meta.title: Scotty #793 Throw Bag w/ 50-Feet of Floating MFP Line
product_meta.description:
Scotty #793 Throw Bag is a bright orange nylon and polyester self-draining bag that comes with adjustable strap and 3M reflective safety band. Braided MFP polypropylene floating rope: 50' x 9/32"" 550 lb. test.

Scotty manufactures products that are sold into the fishing, marine, and outdoor industries worldwide. We have all the gear from Pot Pullers, manual and electric Downriggers, Rod Holders, Oar Locks, Fishfinder, Rod, and Float Tube Mounts, to Safety Equipment for your boat, kayak, and stand up paddle board. When it comes to on the water safety, Scotty has got you covered! Scotty safety equipment ranges from Rescue Throw Bags, Whistles, Flashlights, and Sea-Lights. 

We have total commitment to quality, and unmatched service. That means our customers everywhere can expect reliability and satisfaction from every product that carries the Scotty name. With Scotty you will find the right Downrigger, Mounting System and Accessories to suit your fishing, boating, kayaking and stand up paddle board needs.

The Package Length Of The Product Is 4.55 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 10.75 Inches
